paper_abstract: Sevilla carpets have already been used to compare different solutions of the Subset Sum problem: either designed in the framework of P systems with active membranes ( both in the case of membrane division and membrane creation), and in the framework of tissue-like P systems with cell division. Recently, the degree of parallelism and other descriptive complexity details have been found to be relevant when designing parallel simulators running on GPUs. We present here a new way to use the information provided by Sevilla carpets in this context, and a script that allows to generate them automatically from P-Lingua files.
paper_title: Sevilla Carpets Revisited: Enriching the Membrane Computing Toolbox
